topPRs.title: feat: add CLI delegation debug tool
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Overview

This PR adds a comprehensive debug tool for diagnosing ElizaOS CLI delegation issues. The script helps developers understand why local CLI delegation might not be working and provides automatic fixes for common problems.

## Features

- **Comprehensive Analysis**: Checks environment variables, local CLI installation, project structure, and process arguments
- **Auto-fix Mode**: Can automatically install missing dependencies and suggest fixes
- **Detailed Reporting**: Provides color-coded output showing exactly what would cause delegation to fail
- **Help Documentation**: Built-in help system explaining usage and common issues

## Usage

```bash
# Run debug analysis
bun scripts/debug-cli-delegation.js

# Attempt to fix common issues
bun scripts/debug-cli-delegation.js --fix

# Show help
bun scripts/debug-cli-delegation.js --help
```

## Key Checks

- Local @elizaos/cli installation presence and validity
- Environment variables that would skip delegation (test mode, CI, etc.)
- Process arguments that affect delegation
- Project structure and package.json configuration
- Whether currently running from local CLI

## Benefits

- Reduces debugging time for CLI delegation issues
- Provides clear guidance on fixing common problems
- Helps maintain consistent development experience
- Supports both manual analysis and automated fixes

## Testing

The script has been tested with various scenarios:
- Missing local CLI installation
- Test/CI environments
- Different process arguments
- Various project configurations

Fixes #[issue-number] (if applicable)

topPRs.title: docs: standardize all documentation to use bun:test exclusively
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## üìö Documentation Update: Standardize Testing Framework

This PR updates all documentation and rules files to align with the latest project standards, specifically standardizing on **bun:test** as the exclusive testing framework.

### üéØ Key Changes

#### **Testing Framework Standardization**
- ‚ùå **Removed all references** to , , 
- ‚úÖ **Standardized on ** exclusively across all documentation
- üîÑ **Updated mocking syntax** from  and  to 
- üóëÔ∏è **Removed deprecated config files** like 

#### **TypeScript Standards Enhancement**
- ‚ùå **NEVER use** `any`, `never`, or `unknown` types
- ‚úÖ **ALWAYS use** specific types that accurately represent data
- ‚úÖ **Code must compile** without TypeScript errors or warnings
- ‚úÖ **All tests must pass** before code is considered complete

#### **Testing Philosophy Update**
- üîÑ **Prefer integration tests** over isolated unit tests
- ‚úÖ **Real functionality flow coverage** emphasized
- üìã **Comprehensive test completion requirements**

### üìÅ Files Updated (20 files)

#### **Core Rule Files**
- `.cursorrules` - Added strict TypeScript and testing standards
- `CLAUDE.md` - Enhanced testing philosophy and code style guidelines

#### **Package Documentation (7 files)**
- `packages/cli/README.md`
- `packages/client/scripts/README.md`
- `packages/core/README.md`
- `packages/plugin-starter/README.md`
- `packages/project-starter/README.md`
- `packages/test-utils/README.md`
- `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/__tests__/README.md`

#### **Official Documentation (8 files)**
- `packages/docs/docs/cli/test.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/core/project.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/core/testing.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/migration/plugin-migration-detailed.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/migration/plugin-migration-tutorial.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/technical/api-reference/actions-api.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/technical/development/creating-plugins.md`

#### **Migration Guides (3 files)**
- `packages/cli/src/utils/upgrade/CLAUDE.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/plugins/migration/claude-code/integrated-migration-loop.md`
- `packages/docs/docs/plugins/migration/claude-code/migration-guide.md`

### üîç Impact

This update ensures:
- **Consistent testing framework** across all documentation
- **Clear developer guidance** on testing standards
- **Proper TypeScript practices** enforcement
- **Alignment with project architecture** decisions

### ‚úÖ Testing

- All documentation has been reviewed for consistency
- No functional code changes - documentation only
- Migration guides updated to reflect current standards

### üìã Checklist

- [x] Removed all jest/vitest references
- [x] Updated to bun:test exclusively  
- [x] Added TypeScript strict typing requirements
- [x] Updated mocking examples
- [x] Enhanced testing philosophy
- [x] Updated migration guides
- [x] Verified consistency across all docs

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Documentation**
  * Updated all references from Vitest (and Jest, where applicable) to Bun's built-in test runner (`bun:test`) across documentation, guides, and code examples.
  * Clarified that `bun:test` is now the exclusive test framework, with related configuration and migration instructions updated accordingly.
  * Enhanced TypeScript code style guidelines, including stricter type usage and requirements for passing tests and error-free code.
  * Updated example code snippets and test commands to reflect the new testing setup.
